title.narrative: Protection services and distribution of non-food items (NFIs) to crisis-affected people in the northern part of Rakhine State

description.narrative: The main objective of this joint UNHCR/OHCHR project is provide critical emergency assistance to meet the basic human rights, protection and NFI needs of displaced and conflict affected people in Maungdaw, Buthidaung and Rathedaung townships in Rakhine state. OHCHR will use CERF to conduct protection monitoring and documentation and to advocate and facilitate appropriate follow-up actions to identified human rights violations by engaging the affected communities, humanitarian organizations and state authorities. An estimated 20,000 people will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within six months.

participating-org.narrative: Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS MYANMAR RAPID RESPONSE HUMAN RIGHTS 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
